text: This Act may be called the National Commission for Allied and Healthcare Professions Act, 2021.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: It shall come into force on such date1 as the Central Government may, by notification, appoint; and different dates may be appointed for different provisions of this Act and any reference in any provision to the commencement of this Act shall be construed as a reference to the coming into force of that provision.

text: A person who studies, advises, researches, supervises or provides preventive, curative, rehabilitative, therapeutic services and has obtained any qualification of degree under this Act, the duration of which shall not be less than three thousand six hundred hours spread over a period of three years to six years divided into specific semesters. This also includes a scientist, therapist or other professional.

text: The Commission is a body corporate with perpetual succession, a common seal, power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and to contract. It can sue or be sued by the same name.

text: The salaries and allowances payable to, and other conditions of service of, the Chairperson and Vice-Chairperson of the Commission shall be such as may be prescribed by the Central Government.

text: A Part-time Member may resign by giving notice of not less than three months to the Central Government.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: A Part-time Member can be removed from office if he has been adjudged insolvent, convicted of an offence involving moral turpitude, become physically or mentally incapable of acting, acquired a financial or other interest likely to affect prejudicially his functions, abused his position, or continued in office is prejudicial to the public interest.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: A Part-time Member shall not be removed from his office under clause (d) or clause (e) of sub-section
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: A Member of the Commission, upon cessation to the service by virtue of which he was appointed as a Member of the Commission, shall cease to be a Member.

topic: Cessation of membership and filling up of casual vacancy of Member

text: A Member of the Commission shall cease to be a Member upon removal of his name from the register of the State Council.

topic: Cessation of membership and filling up of casual vacancy of Member

text: A person appointed under section 3 shall hold office only for the remainder of the term of the Member in whose place he has been appointed.

text: The Commission shall meet at least once in every quarter
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Commission shall meet at least once in every quarter at such time and place as may be decided by the Chairperson, and shall observe such rules of procedure in regard to the transaction of business at its meetings.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Chairperson shall preside over the meeting of the Commission.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: If, for any reason, he is unable to attend the meeting of the Commission, the Vice-Chairperson shall preside over the meeting.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: One-half of the total number of Members of the Commission including the Chairperson or Vice-Chairperson shall constitute the quorum and all decisions of the Commission shall be taken by a majority of the Members, present and voting; and in the event of equality of votes, the Chairperson or in his absence, the Vice-Chairperson shall have a second or casting vote.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Secretariat of the Commission shall also provide Secretarial assistance to the Professional Council and the Advisory Council.

text: The Commission shall constitute Professional Councils for every recognised category.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Commission shall, by notification, constitute Professional Council for every recognised category and shall consist of a president and members, not less than four and not exceeding twenty-four.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The president shall rotate biennially amongst the professions in the recognised category.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: Where there is no person from a particular recognised profession represented in the Commission, if the Commission is of opinion that the decision taken by it affects that profession,
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The president and the member of the Professional Council shall be a registered professional of the respective category.
applies_to: President | Member of the Professional Council
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Commission shall take steps for ensuring coordinated and integrated development of education and maintenance of the standards of delivery of services under this Act.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: 10 (a) The Commission may frame policies and standards for the governance of allied and healthcare related education and professional services.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: 10 (b) The Commission may regulate the professional conduct, code of ethics and etiquette to be observed by the allied and healthcare professionals by or under this Act.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: 10 (c) The Commission may create and maintain an up-to-date online and live Central Register with details of academic qualifications institutions, training, skill and competencies of allied and healthcare professionals related to their profession as specified in the Schedule.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: 10 (d) The Commission shall provide scope of practice of each profession keeping in view, inter alia, need for task shifting.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: 10 (e) The Commission shall provide basic standards of education, courses, curricula, physical and instructional facilities, staff pattern, staff qualifications, quality instructions, assessment, examination, training, research, continuing professional education, maximum tuition fee payable in respect of various categories, proportionate distribution of seats and promote innovations in categories in the manner as may be specified by regulations.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: 10 (f) The Commission shall provide the allied and healthcare professionals with the scope to practice their profession.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: This text appears to discuss regulations related to allied and healthcare professionals, including admission criteria, examinations, manpower deployment, standards, and committees for technical advice.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Commission shall hold an Annual Meeting of the Commission with the National Medical Commission constituted under section 3 of the National Medical Commission Act, 2019 (30 of 2019) and the Central Council constituted under section 3 of the Homoeopathy Central Council Act, 1973 (59 of 1973). The Commission shall perform such other functions as may be entrusted to it by the Central Government or as may be necessary to carry out the provisions of this Act.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Central Government shall constitute an Advisory Council to be known as National Allied and Healthcare Advisory Council.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: National Allied and Healthcare Advisory Council

text: The Advisory Council shall consist of the following persons:— (i) Chairperson of the Commission--Chairperson; (ii) all Members of the Commission--ex officio member; (iii) Principal Secretary dealing with medical education or his nominee from each State--member; (iv) Chairperson of the State Council--member; and 11 (v) Principal Secretary dealing with medical education or his nominee representing each Union territory--member.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: National Allied and Healthcare Advisory Council

text: The Advisory Council shall meet once in a year at Delhi as may be decided by the Chairperson of the Advisory Council.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: National Allied and Healthcare Advisory Council

text: The text pertains to persons holding office as an allied and healthcare professional, providing service in any of the recognised categories, and signing or authenticating certificates required by law.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: Rights of persons who are enrolled on Central Register

text: A registered allied and healthcare professional is prohibited from holding office as an allied and healthcare professional (by whatever name called) in Government or in any institution maintained by a local or other authority, providing service in any of the recognised categories in any State, and being entitled to sign or authenticate any certificate required by any law for the time being in force to be signed or authenticated by a duly qualified allied and healthcare professional.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: Rights of persons who are enrolled on Central Register

text: The Commission may enter a person's name in the Central Register upon receipt of the report of registration from a State Register or on an application.

text: Any person whose name has been entered in the Central Register
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: he shall, on an application made in this behalf in such form and in such manner and on payment of such fees as may be prescribed by the Central Government, be entitled to have an entry stating such degree or diploma or such other qualifications made against his name in such register in addition to any entry previously made.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The entries in respect of any such person in a State Register shall be altered in accordance with the alterations made in the Central Register.

text: The Central Government shall constitute an Interim Commission within sixty days from the date on which this Act receives the assent of the President.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Interim Commission constituted under sub-section
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The text defines 'member' in the context of the Central Government, with a provision for Interim Commission to engage experts from unrepresented professions specified in the Schedule as necessary.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Central Government shall appoint a Secretary to the Interim Commission.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Central Government shall appoint the Chairperson, Vice-Chairperson and the Secretary of the Commission.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Search-cum-Selection Committee shall consist of the following persons, namely:-- (a) the Secretary, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare--Chairperson; (b) the Secretary or his nominee, not below the rank of Additional Secretary of Department of Higher Education, Ministry of Education--member; 13 (c) four experts, possessing outstanding qualifications and experience of not less than twenty-five years in the field of allied and healthcare education, public health education and health research to be nominated by the Central Government--members; (d) one person, possessing outstanding qualifications and experience of not less than twenty-five years in the field of management or law or economics or science and technology to be nominated by the Central Government--member; and (e) Additional Secretary to the Government of India in the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare Convener--member.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Central Government shall make a reference within a period of three months from the date of occurrence of any vacancy in the Commission.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Central Government shall select the Chairperson, Vice-Chairperson or Secretary of the Commission within three months from the date of occurrence of any vacancy.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Search-cum-Selection Committee shall recommend a panel of at least three names for each vacancy.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Search-cum-Selection Committee shall recommend any person for appointment of the Chairperson or Vice-Chairperson or Secretary.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Search-cum-Selection Committee shall satisfy itself that such person does not have any financial or other interest which is likely to affect prejudicially his functions as such Chairperson, Vice-Chairperson or Secretary.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: No appointment of the Chairperson or Vice-Chairperson or Secretary of the Commission shall be invalid merely by reason of any vacancy or absence of a member in the Search-cum-Selection Committee.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The text is subject to the provisions of sub-sections
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Search-cum-Selection Committee may regulate its own procedure.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: Every State Government shall, by notification, within six months from the date of commencement of this Act, constitute a State Council to be called the State Allied and Healthcare Council for exercising such powers and discharging such duties as may be laid down under this Act.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: Constitution and composition of State Council

text: The State Council is a body corporate with perpetual succession, a common seal, power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and to contract. It can sue or be sued by the same name.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: Constitution and composition of State Council

text: The text refers to members of a board or committee in a clinical establishment or hospital, who are nominated by the State Government. These members belong to recognised categories specified in the Schedule and have qualifications and experience as prescribed by the State Government.

text: The term of office for a person holding a position under section 22 is not more than two years from the date they start their role, and they are eligible for re-nomination for a maximum period of two terms.

text: A Member may relinquish his office by giving notice of not less than three months to the State Government. The Member can also be removed from his office under certain conditions.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: A Member can be removed from his office if he has been adjudged insolvent, convicted of an offence involving moral turpitude, become physically or mentally incapable of acting as a Member, acquired financial or other interests likely to affect prejudicially his functions as a Member, abused his position so as to render his continuance in office prejudicial to the public interest.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Under-graduate Allied and Healthcare Education Board and Post-graduate Allied and Healthcare Education Board shall determine standards of allied and healthcare education at the graduate, postgraduate level and super-speciality level.

text: The Allied and Healthcare Profession Ethics and Registration Board shall maintain online and live State Registers of all licensed allied and healthcare practitioners in the State, regulate the professional conduct and undertake any other function as entrusted by the State Council.

text: The duty of the State Council is to take steps for ensuring the co-ordinated and integrated development of education and maintenance of the standards of delivery of services under this Act.

text: The State Council shall enter the name of the recognised categories, enforce professional conduct, code of ethics and etiquette to be observed by allied and healthcare professionals in the State and take disciplinary action, including the removal of a professionals' name from the State Register.

text: The State Council shall ensure minimum standards of education, courses, curricula, physical and instructional facilities, staff pattern, staff qualifications, quality instructions, assessment, examination, training, research, continuing professional education.

law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The State Council shall ensure uniform exit or licensing examination for the allied and healthcare professionals under this Act.

text: The State Council may remove a person's name from the State Register if it is entered by error, due to misrepresentation or suppression of a material fact, or if the person has been convicted of an offence involving moral turpitude and punishable with imprisonment, has been guilty of any infamous conduct in any professional respect, or has violated the standards of professional conduct and etiquette or the code of ethics which, in the opinion of the State Council, renders him unfit to be kept in the said register.

text: Every person who offers his services in any of the recognised categories on or before the commencement of this Act shall be allowed to be provisionally registered under the provisions of this Act within such period from such commencement in such manner as may be specified by regulations.

text: A scheme of reciprocity is not in force for certain qualifications, and they will only be recognized under this Act after a specified date, provided that the foreign nationals possessing such qualification are enrolled as allied and healthcare professionals in accordance with the law regulating the registration of allied and healthcare professionals for the time being in force in that country, and are limited to the period specified by the Central Government.

text: The text refers to orders, decisions, and instruments of the Commission or the State Council, as well as officers (Secretary or any other officer authorised by the Chairperson).

text: Orders, decisions, and instruments issued by the Commission or the State Council must be authenticated by the Secretary or any other officer authorised by the Chairperson.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: This Act defines the duties and functions that allied and healthcare professionals are authorized to discharge or perform, as well as the scope of treatment within their profession.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: Practice by allied and healthcare professionals

text: Allied and healthcare professionals shall not discharge any duty or perform any function not authorised by this Act or perform any treatment not authorised within the scope of practice of the profession.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: Practice by allied and healthcare professionals

text: The text refers to a person whose name is not entered in the Central Register or a State Register.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: Penalty for falsely claiming to be entered in Central Register and State Register

text: If any person falsely represents that his name is entered in the Central Register or a State Register, he shall be punished with a fine which may extend to fifty thousand rupees on first conviction and on any subsequent conviction with imprisonment which may extend to six months or with a fine not exceeding one lakh rupees or with both.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: Penalty for falsely claiming to be entered in Central Register and State Register

text: The penalty for the first conviction is a fine which may extend to fifty thousand rupees. On any subsequent conviction, the penalty is imprisonment which may extend to six months or with a fine not exceeding one lakh rupees or with both.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: Penalty for falsely claiming to be entered in Central Register and State Register

text: The text applies to any person who is not registered in the Central Register or a State Register, and does not possess an allied and healthcare qualification under this Act.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: If a person not being registered or not possessing the required qualification uses a description of an allied and healthcare professional, degree, diploma, license, or abbreviation indicating or implying such qualification, they will be punished.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: First conviction: fine up to one lakh rupees. Subsequent convictions: imprisonment up to one year or a fine not exceeding two lakh rupees, or both.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: If any person whose name has been removed from the Central Register or a State Register, he shall surrender forthwith his certificate of registration or certificate of renewal, or both.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: Failure to surrender certificate of registration

text: failing which he shall be punishable with fine which may extend to fifty thousand rupees and in case of a continuing offence with an additional fine which may extend to five thousand rupees per day after the first day during which the offence continues.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: Failure to surrender certificate of registration

text: punishable with fine which may extend to fifty thousand rupees and in case of a continuing offence with an additional fine which may extend to five thousand rupees per day after the first day during which the offence continues.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: Failure to surrender certificate of registration

text: Whoever contravenes any of the provisions of this Act or any rules or regulations made thereunder shall be punished.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: Penalty for contravention of provisions of Act

text: punished with imprisonment which shall not be less than one year but which may extend to three years or with fine which shall not be less than one lakh rupees but which may extend to five lakh rupees or with both.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: Penalty for contravention of provisions of Act

text: No court shall take cognizance of any offence punishable under this Act except upon a complaint made by one of the following: Central Government, State Government, Commission, or State Council.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: No court inferior to that of a Metropolitan Magistrate or a Judicial Magistrate of the first class shall try any offence punishable under this Act.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: No Civil Court shall have jurisdiction to entertain any suit or proceeding in respect of any order made by the Commission or State Council relating to the removal of a name or the refusal to enter a name in the Central Register or State Register, as the case may be, under this Act.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: This Act refers to the Clinical Establishments (Registration and Regulation) Act, 2010.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: Protection of action taken in good faith

text: No legal action can be taken against the Central Government, State Government, or any officials mentioned in the text for actions taken in good faith while enforcing this Act or its rules.
applies_to: Central Government | State Government | Chairperson | Vice-Chairperson | Member of the Commission | Member of the State Council | Member of the Professional Council | Member of the Autonomous Board
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
topic: Protection of action taken in good faith

text: The Central Government may issue directions to the Commission from time to time.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The provisions of this Act shall have overriding effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent therewith contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any instrument having effect by virtue of any law other than this Act.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Central Government may, by notification, make rules to carry out the provisions of this Act.

text: The term 'provision' includes rules, regulations, instructions, directions or orders made under this Act.

text: Every rule made by the Central Government and the regulations made by the Commission under this Act shall be laid before each House of Parliament while it is in session for a total period of thirty days.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The State Government may, by notification, make rules to carry out the provisions of this Act.

text: This Act may have difficulties in implementation, and the Central Government can make necessary or expedient provisions to remove these difficulties, but only if such provisions are not inconsistent with the provisions of this Act.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: Every order made under this section shall, as soon as may be after it is made, be laid before each House of Parliament.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The Central Government may, after consultation with the Commission, by a notification, add to or otherwise amend the Schedule for the purposes of this Act and thereupon the said Schedule shall be deemed to be amended accordingly.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: A copy of every notification proposed to be issued under sub-section
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021

text: The notification shall be laid in draft before each House of Parliament for a total period of thirty days which may be comprised in one session or in two or more successive sessions.
law: THE NATIONAL COMMISSION FOR ALLIED AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONS ACT, 2021
